name: electricity, medium voltage, European attribute mix | electricity, medium voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27503/documentation

This dataset represents the European Attribute Mix (EAM) on the medium voltage level of the year 2022. The shares have been calculated based on statistics from AIB (2023) following the methodology of grexel (2020).  ;The EAM is a virtual mix and is calculated as the sum of all surplus electricity from countries for which the volume of the domestic residual mix is larger than the volume of untracked consumption i.e., electricity consumption that is not explicitly tracked through mechanisms such as Guarantees of Origin (GO). The EAM is used to balance the residual mix for countries for which the volume of untracked consumption is larger than the volume of domestic residual mix, i.e., countries with a deficit in their domestic residual mix. ;For better representation the EAM is modelled in a separate dataset and linked to the residual mixes. See technology comment for a summary of the residual mix calculations. ;The calculation area considered for the calculation of the residual mixes covers all members of EU28, Iceland, Norway, Serbia and Switzerland.;Sources:;- AIB (2023), Association of Issuing Bodies, European Residual Mixes, Results of the calculation of Residual Mixes for the calendar year 2022, Version 1.0, 2022-06-01, https://www.aib-net.org/facts/European-residual-mix/2022;- grexel (2020), Issuance Based Residual Mix Calculation Methodology, Published 31.03.2020, Version 1.1, https://www.aib-net.org/sites/default/files/assets/facts/residual-mix/2022/RM%20EAM%20IB%20Calculation%20Methodology%20V1_2.pdf

This activity starts from 1kWh of electricity from all countries in the calculation area with surplus electricity.

This activity ends with the supply of 1kWh of electricity from all countries in the calculation area with surplus electricity.
This dataset does not include any transmission and distribution nor any infrastructure or direct emission. These are considered in the corresponding residual mix datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The data on the European residual mixes is based on the transactions of guarantees of origin representing the time period of 1.4.2022 - 31.3.2023.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Residual mixes represent a countries pool of not-explicitily tracked electricity consumption. Residual mixes are calculated by first determining the "domestic residual mix", which represents the sum of all domestic electricity production taking into account imports and export and issued and expired attributes. The domestic resiual mix is compared with the volume of a countries untracked consumption and should a surplus occur , this surplus is added to the European attribute mix (EAM). Should a deficit occur, the difference is balanced with the EAM.
